embeds.title: Black Powder
embeds.description:
Common Relic / The Hermit / Downfall

At the end of your turn, deal 2 damage to ALL enemies for each **Dead On** effect triggered.
*Handle with care.*

messages.content: well
this is a common relic
its
definitly a relic
that deals damage
and is common
it's been on a journey to get here
used to be rare, right?
yes
what was its journey?
i dont remember anymore
It’s not gonna be your main damage source but if you’re activating a ton of dead on effects with stuff like <take aim> and <combo> it can do some work

embeds.title: Take Aim
embeds.description:
Uncommon Power / 1 :energy_hermit:  / The Hermit / Downfall

 **Concentrate** :p_concentration:.)
At the start of your turn, **Concentrate** :p_concentration:.

embeds.title: Combo
embeds.description:
Uncommon Power / 1 :energy_hermit:  / The Hermit / Downfall

Put the first  (2) **Dead On** card (cards) triggered each turn back into your hand.

messages.content: its FREE damage! ends up being a about the same value as a hourglass on average but its just a common. With a dedicated dead on deck this being able to deal 6 or 8 damage can help out vs reptomancer which is a really scary  fight for you; although that far into the game its only really that fight were the added aoe damage is relevant
should be buffed tbh
eh it's pretty balanced
trash outside dead on decks but some relics are just like that
Yeah compared to <mercury hourglass> it's a little weaker on average, but it's a common so...

embeds.title: Mercury Hourglass
embeds.description:
Uncommon Relic / All / Slay the Spire

At the start of your turn, deal 3 damage to ALL enemies.
*An enchanted hourglass that endlessly drips.*

messages.content: It’s not great, basically a less reliable mercury hourglass. Sometimes you can deal 4 or 6 damage, but most of the time you aren’t getting more than 2 a turn. Do keep in mind that this triggers at the end of the turn, so don’t overkill enemies that are already at 2/4 health. For a common, it's okay, but I am not happy to see this as a random drop, and I would probably never buy it at a store. Even if your deck is very dedicated to dead-on, this isn't that much stronger than mercury hourglass.
Question: if it were to be 2 block instead of 2 aoe damage, would it be balanced? I don't want to see it changed, I think it's fine. Just curious what you all think.

something I forgot to ask:
@Kiku are you ok with your pfp being used in a card art?
2 block would be better imo
usually hermit doesn't really have a problem with damage outside possibly dead on decks where you are running shit ton of <dive> <dead on weak> <vantage>

embeds.title: Smoking Barrel
embeds.description:
Uncommon Power / 1 :energy_hermit:  / The Hermit / Downfall

Whenever you trigger a **Dead On** effect, your next attack deals 3 (4) more damage.

footer.text: <dead on next attack power> = smoking barrel, 112.36

messages.content: i forgot it uses basegame wording instead of vigor lol
but that's in general the only type of thing where i could see lacking damage
and even then you could just take a <bruise power>

embeds.title: Brawl
embeds.description:
Uncommon Power / 2 :energy_hermit:  / The Hermit / Downfall

At the start of your turn, apply 3 (5) **Bruise** :p_bruise: to ALL enemies.

messages.content: Okay
except with a lot more text

I would definitely like black powder more if it gave you block for triggering dead-on instead. That would be a cool contrast with smoking barrel, and 2/4/6 block a turn feels like a nice payoff for building a more dedicated dead-on deck, especially for a common relic when compared to brass tacks (common) and thread and needle (rare)
probably a bit too high with 2 per proc maybe
if we're comparing to brass tacks
yeah
some decks can easily proc this relic more than once a turn
maybe every 3 gain 4
lmao no, how often do you play 3 dead on cards in a turn???
<eternal form> go brrr

embeds.title: Cheat

**Dead On:** Also trigger its **Dead On** effect.
